system.description:
A robed and gowned witch clad in flowers, oils, and golden ornaments. Their spells are fueled by a certain hatred, a certain anger. This passion and strength they harness to supercharge their witchcraft, to strengthen the magickal effects of their hexes upon their foes.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter. Check the book for higher ranks.)
system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Spite. Attack a fighter in range 4 with Faith, then they suffer -1d on their next Defense roll.

Gambits [[/r d6]]

1-2: Rush > Inflict Violence > Rush

3-4: Unlash [1]: Gain Float until the end of the Curser's next riff > Rush > Inflict Violence

5: Rush > Kindle [2]: Attack all enemies in an area (range 3 burst 1) with Faith, setting aflame.

6: Rush > Witch Mangrove [2]: Attack an enemy in range 5 with Faith, and then all enemies in burst 2 (including the target) cannot move voluntarily until the end of their next riff.

traits.name: Conviction
traits.description: All Folk have a reason for fighting, and if reasoned to, can cause them to rethink combat. However, they will fight for their Conviction until it looks like all is bleak.

traits.name: Morale
traits.description: At the beginning of any Resound where there are twice as many Kadungganan than there are enemies (eg., If there are 4 Kadungganan and 2 Enemies left) all Folk enemies will Surrender, becoming Defeated.

traits.name: It's Time To Raid!
traits.description: At the beginning of a Resound, the Gatusan fighters choose a single enemy in the field as their Raid Target. All their attacks against the Raid Target gain Overwhelming. If that enemy is brought to 0 HP, all Gatusan fighters in the field can heal 2 and move 2.

traits.name: Sympathy
traits.description: Choose any tile within range 5 of the Curser. A spirit arises from it, which cannot be targeted. The curser can choose the curse-spirit as the origin point for any effect.
